settings_interface module¶

platform

Unix, Windows

synopsis

This module contains all get/set methods for settings. It’s not particularly interesting but facilitates clean code.

moduleauthor

Michael Eller <mbe9a@virginia.edu>

settings_interface.fieldnames = ['window_samples', 'sample_rate', 'x_axis_size', 'y_axis_min', 'y_axis_max']¶

static fieldnames for the settings dict / csv file

settings_interface.default_window_samples = 1¶

default number of samples to average in a moving average filter

settings_interface.default_sample_rate = 10¶

default sample rate in samples / sec

settings_interface.default_x_axis_size = 30¶

default x axis range in seconds

settings_interface.default_y_axis_min = 0¶

default y-axis minimum in volts

settings_interface.default_y_axis_max = 60¶

default y-axis maximum in volts

settings_interface.m1 = 14.3¶

slope of V_measured vs. V_in for V_in < 10 V

settings_interface.b1 = -1¶

intercept of V_measured vs. V_in for V_in < 10 V

settings_interface.m2 = 14.976¶

slope of V_measured vs. V_in for V_in > 10 V

settings_interface.b2 = -3.7¶

slope of V_measured vs. V_in for V_in > 10 V

settings_interface.generate_plotting_configuration_file()[source]¶

Will write a new plot configuration (settings) file in the appropriate location. This will overwrite any existing settings. This is used when the user restores default settings from within the GUI.

settings_interface.read_plotting_configuration()[source]¶

Read the current settings configuration. If the file doesn’t exist, generate the default.

Returns

Dict object containing the GUI’s settings.

settings_interface.save_plotting_configuration(settings)[source]¶

This function will edit the file based on the dict of settings passed.

Parameters

settings – Dict of settings

settings_interface.set_window_samples(num)[source]¶

Sets the number of samples to use in the moving average filter.

Parameters

num – number of samples

Returns

bool indicating whether or not the operation was successful

settings_interface.get_window_samples()[source]¶

Read the saved window samples setting from the file.

Returns

saved window samples

settings_interface.set_sample_rate(rate)[source]¶

Set the sample rate and save it in the settings file.

Parameters

rate – ADC sample rate in samples per second. 1 < rate < 100.

Returns

bool indicating whether or not the operation was successful.

settings_interface.get_sample_rate()[source]¶

Get the saved ADC sample rate.

Returns

the ADC sample rate (float)

settings_interface.set_x_axis_size(size)[source]¶

Set the total width of the live plot in seconds. The number of samples depends on this and the sample rate. Total number of samples in the plot is equal to the x-axis size * sample rate.

Parameters

size – x-axis size in seconds. 5 < int(size) < 3600.

Returns

bool indicating whether or not the operation was successful.

settings_interface.get_x_axis_size()[source]¶

Get the x-axis length in seconds.

Returns

x-axis size (int)

settings_interface.set_y_axis_min(minimum)[source]¶

Set the lower limit of the y-axis data in volts.

Parameters

minimum – lower limit of data y-axis. -60 < minimum < 69.9

Returns

bool indicating if the operation was so successful or not

settings_interface.get_y_axis_min()[source]¶

Get the y-axis lower limit in volts.

Returns

y-axis minimum (float)

settings_interface.set_y_axis_max(maximum)[source]¶

Set the upper limit of the y-axis in volts. 1 < maximum < 70

Parameters

maximum – upper limit of the y-axis in volts

Returns

bool indicating whether or not the operation was successful

settings_interface.get_y_axis_max()[source]¶

Get the y-axis upper limit in volts.

Returns

the y-axis maximum (float)

settings_interface.save_port_configuration(port)[source]¶

This function sets the separate file that indicates which serial port to use.

Parameters

port – ADC serial port (string)

settings_interface.read_port_configuration()[source]¶

Get the saved ADC serial port.

Returns

serial port (string)

settings_interface.restore_defaults()[source]¶

This function resets all settings to the defaults stored in this file.
